sen.j: 海苔（のり）は、紅藻・緑藻・シアノバクテリア（藍藻）などを含む、食用とする藻類の総称。
sen.e: Nori is a general term for edible algae such as red alga, green alga, cyanobacteria (blue-green alga) and so on.
Nori is a general term for edible algae such as red alga, green alga, cyanobacteria (blue-green alga) and so on.
Nori is a general term for edible algae such as red alga, green alga, cyanobacteria (blue-green alga) and so on.

sen.j: また、それらの藻類を漉いて紙状に乾燥させた食品。
sen.e: Or, refers to the food products where algae were dissolved in water, picked up, spread like a sheet of paper and dried.
Alternatively, it refers to the food products where algae were dissolved in water, picked up, spread like a sheet of paper and dried.
Alternatively, it refers to the food products where algae were dissolved in water, picked up, spread like a sheet of paper and dried.

sen.j: （→海藻も参照のこと）
sen.e: (=>See seaweed)
(=>See seaweed)
(=>See seaweed)

sen.j: 日本語の「ノリ」はもともと水中の岩石に苔類のように着生する藻類全般を表す語であったため、食用としない多くの種類の藻類にも、しばしば○○ノリ、～～ノリという名前が付いていることがある。
sen.e: As the word 'nori' in Japanese originally refers to epiphytic algae as a whole which live on rocks under water like Hepaticae, many kinds of algae that is not edible often have a name like 'XXX nori' or 'YYY nori'.

Because the word 'nori' in Japanese originally refers to epiphytic algae as a whole, which live on rocks underwater, like Hepaticae, many kinds of algae that are not edible often have names such as 'XXX nori' or 'YYY nori.'

Because the word 'nori' in Japanese originally refers to epiphytic algae as a whole, which live on rocks underwater, like Hepaticae, many kinds of algae that are not edible often have names such as 'XXX nori' or 'YYY nori.'

sen.j: 食用の海苔は、分類学的には以下のような互いに疎遠なグループに分けられる。
sen.e: Taxonomically, edible algae are categorized in mutually distant groups as follows.
Taxonomically, edible algae are categorized in mutually distant groups, as follows:

sen.j: 海藻。

sen.j: 真核生物ドメイン・植物界・紅色植物門・紅藻亜門・ウシケノリ綱・ウシケノリ目・ウシケノリ科・アマノリ属 (Porphyra) に属するグループ。
sen.e: The group belongs to eukaryote domain, Plantae, Rhodophyta, Bangiophyceae, Bangiales, Bangiaceae, Porphyra.
The group belongs to the eukaryote domain Plantae, Rhodophyta, Bangiophyceae, Bangiales, Bangiaceae, Porphyra.
The group belongs to the eukaryote domain Plantae, Rhodophyta, Bangiophyceae, Bangiales, Bangiaceae, Porphyra.

sen.j: 岩海苔（いのり）とも呼ばれ、板海苔に加工される、アサクサノリ、スサビノリ (P. yezoensis)、ウップルイノリ (P. pseudolinearis) など。
sen.e: Asakusa nori' (P. tenera), 'Susabi nori' (P. yezoensis), 'Uppurui nori' (P. pseudolinearis) and so on are in this group and are also called 'i-nori' (rock nori) and processed into 'ita nori' (dried nori, but not toasted).
sen.cmt: 岩海苔を「いのり」と称するという点に関しては、ウィキペディア情報以外では確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Asakusa nori (P. tenera),' 'Susabi nori (P. yezoensis),' 'Uppurui nori (P. pseudolinearis)' and so on are in this group; they're also called 'i-nori (rock nori)' and are processed into 'ita nori' (which is dried nori but not toasted).

Asakusa nori (P. tenera),' 'Susabi nori (P. yezoensis),' 'Uppurui nori (P. pseudolinearis)' and so on are in this group; they're also called 'i-nori (rock nori)' and are processed into 'ita nori' (which is dried nori but not toasted).

sen.j: 南ウェールズで食べられる（P. umbilcalis）もこの属である。
sen.e: P. umbilcalis eaten in South Wales belongs to this genus.
P. umbilcalis, which is eaten in South Wales, belongs to this genus.

sen.j: 韓国海苔もこの属から作られる。
sen.e: Kankoku nori' (Korean nori) is also processed from this genus.

sen.e: The group includes the sea lettuce or green laver which belongs to eukaryote domain, Plantae, Chlorophyta, Chlorophytina, Ulvophyceae, Ulvales, Ulvaceae.

sen.j: 分類学的にはそれぞれ大きく離れているが、2と3は同じ緑藻に属し、いくらか近縁。
sen.e: Taxonomically all of them are widely different from each other, however, 2 and 3 belong to the same green alga and somewhat closely related.
sen.cmt: ２、３という表示が上にはございませんが、あるとして訳しました。
sen.e: Taxonomically, each of them is dramatically different, but 2 and 3 belong to the same green alga and somewhat closely related.
Taxonomically, each of them is dramatically different, but 2 and 3 belong to the same green alga and somewhat closely related.

sen.j: 4は大きくかけ離れており、通常言う植物には含まれない。
sen.e: 4 is widely different from the others and does not belong to normal plants.
Number 4 is widely different from the others is not classifiable among normal plants.
Number 4 is widely different from the others, and is not classifiable among normal plants.
sen.cmt: 文として違和感が強いので、「, and」を追加しました。

sen.j: 分類群が異なるため生活環はそれぞれ異なるが、いずれも解明されている。
sen.e: Though they belong to the different taxonomic groups and their life circles are also different, all of them are elucidated sufficiently.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「分類群が異なるため」→「分類群が異なり」
sen.e: Though they belong to different taxonomic groups and their life circles are different, each of them is sufficiently elucidated.
Though they belong to different taxonomic groups and their life circles are different, each of them is sufficiently elucidated.

sen.j: 1と2は、解明された知見を利用して人為的にライフサイクルを制御し大量に種苗を作ることで、商業規模での養殖が可能となっている。
sen.e: As for 1 and 2, by using the knowledge that is acquired by the elucidation and artificially managing the life cycles, the seedlings can be produced in high volume and cultured on a commercial scale.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As for 1 and 2, by using the knowledge acquired through the elucidation and artificially managing the life cycles, the seedlings can be produced in high volumes and cultured on a commercial scale.
As for 1 and 2, by using the knowledge acquired through the elucidation and artificially managing the life cycles, the seedlings can be produced in high volumes and cultured on a commercial scale.

sen.j: ここでは、主に前節の1のアマノリ属について述べる。
sen.e: Here, 1 Porphyra in the former section is mainly described.
Here, 1 Porphyra in the former section is mainly described.

sen.j: ウップルイノリ（岩海苔）とスサビノリは、寿司（海苔巻き、軍艦巻き）、おにぎり、磯辺餅、ふりかけ、ラーメンの具などに使われる。
sen.e: Uppurui nori' (P. pseudolinearis) and 'Susabi nori' (P. yezoensis) are used in sushi (nori-maki, gunkan-maki), onigiri (rice balls), isobe-mochi (isobe rice cakes), furikake (powdered seasoning agents), fillings in ramen and so on.

Uppurui nori (P. pseudolinearis)' and 'Susabi nori (P. yezoensis)' are used in sushi (nori-maki, gunkan-maki), onigiri (rice balls), isobe-mochi (isobe rice cakes), furikake (powdered seasoning agents), fillings in ramen and so on.

Uppurui nori (P. pseudolinearis)' and 'Susabi nori (P. yezoensis)' are used in sushi (nori-maki, gunkan-maki), onigiri (rice balls), isobe-mochi (isobe rice cakes), furikake (powdered seasoning agents), fillings in ramen and so on.

sen.j: 一方で、フノリ（布海苔）やアオノリ（青海苔）は、前者同様、おにぎり、ふりかけの他に、お好み焼きのふりかけ、お吸い物などに使われる。
sen.e: Fu nori' (cloth nori) and 'ao nori' (blue nori) are, on the other hand, used in furikake on okonomiyaki (Japanese style pizza) or osuimono (soup) and so on as well as onigiri or furikake.
Fu nori (cloth nori)' and 'ao nori (blue nori)' are, on the other hand, used in furikake on okonomiyaki (Japanese-style pizza) or osuimono (soup) and so on, as well as onigiri or furikake.
Fu nori (cloth nori)' and 'ao nori (blue nori)' are, on the other hand, used as furikake for okonomiyaki (Japanese-style pizza) or osuimono (soup) and so on, as well as onigiri or furikake.
sen.cmt: フノリやアオノリは単独で使うことが多いと思うので、「used in furikake on」→「used as furikake for」としました。

sen.j: 日本では極めてよく利用される食材である。
sen.e: They are quite often used as foodstuffs in Japan.
They are very often used as foodstuffs in Japan.
They are very often used as foodstuffs in Japan.

sen.j: 味を付けている海苔を「味付け海苔」と言う。
sen.e: Seasoned nori is called 'aji-tsuke nori' (seasoned or flavored nori).
Seasoned nori is called 'aji-tsuke nori' (seasoned or flavored nori).
Seasoned nori is called 'aji-tsuke nori (seasoned or flavored nori).'
sen.cmt: シングルクォートの位置修正

sen.j: 老舗である山本海苔店が開発した。
sen.e: It was developed by the well-established YAMAMOTO nori shop.
It was developed by the well-established YAMAMOTO nori shop.
It was developed by the well-established Yamamoto Noriten Company.

sen.j: そのほか、海苔を細かく刻んだきざみ海苔や、海苔の佃煮（関東では桃屋の「江戸むらさき ごはんですよ!」、関西では磯じまん・ブンセンの「アラ!」などが代表的）などがある。
sen.e: Moreover, there are 'kizami nori' (chopped or shredded nori), 'nori-no-tsukudani' and so on (laver boiled down in soy, Momoya's 'Edo Murasaki Gohan-desuyo!' in the Kanto region, Isojiman-Bunsen's 'Ala!' in the Kansai region and so on are famous).

Moreover, there are 'kizami nori' (chopped or shredded nori), 'nori-no-tsukudani' and so on (laver boiled down in soy, Momoya's 'Edo Murasaki Gohan-desuyo!' in the Kanto region, Isojiman-Bunsen's 'Ala!' in the Kansai region and so on are famous).

Moreover, there are 'kizami nori (chopped or shredded nori),' 'nori-no-tsukudani' and so on (laver boiled down in soy, Momoya's 'Edo Murasaki Gohan-desuyo!' in the Kanto region, Isojiman-Bunsen's 'Ala!' in the Kansai region and so on are famous).
sen.cmt: シングルクォートの位置修正

sen.j: また、海苔にはたんぱく質、食物繊維、ビタミンなどが豊富に含まれており栄養に富んでいる。
sen.e: And nori is nutritious and richly includes proteins, dietary fibers, vitamins and so on.
Additionally, nori is rich in protein, dietary fiber, vitamins and so on.
Additionally, nori is rich in protein, dietary fiber, vitamins and so on.

sen.j: なお、乾燥させた海苔は湿気に弱いので、乾燥剤を入れた密封容器に保存する。
sen.e: Dried nori is sensitive to humidity and so is stored in a closed container with desiccant in it.
Dried nori is sensitive to humidity, so it's stored in a closed container with desiccant in it.
Dried nori is sensitive to humidity, so it's stored in a closed container with desiccant agent in it.

sen.j: 古くは紫菜（むらさきのり・あまのり）・小凝菜（いぎす・テングサ）・鹿角菜（ヒジキ）などをのりと称した。
sen.e: They used to call 'murasaki nori, ama nori', 'igisu, tengusa', 'hijiki' and so on as 'nori'.
Formerly, 'murasaki nori, ama nori,' 'igisu, tengusa,' 'hijiki' and so on were referred to as 'nori.'
Formerly, 'murasaki nori (ama nori),' 'igisu (tengusa),' 'hijiki' and so on were referred to as 'nori.'
sen.cmt: カッコを使って表記を整理しました。

sen.j: とくにヒジキなどは、粘りを利用し、紙と紙を接着する接着剤としても使用された。
sen.e: Hijiki, in particular, is also used as glue for pieces of paper because of its viscosity.
Hijiki, in particular, is also used as a glue for pieces of paper because of its viscosity.
Hijiki, in particular, was also used as a glue for pieces of paper because of its viscosity.

sen.j: 糊をのりというのは、奈良時代に於いて紙を貼り合わせる物が海苔だったことに由来すると考えられる。
sen.e: Nori' (glue) is called as such because originally the 'nori' (laver) was used for glue for pieces of paper during the Nara period.
Nori (glue)' is called as such because, during the Nara period, the 'nori (laver)' was used in gluing together pieces of paper.
Nori (glue)' is called as such because, during the Nara period, the 'nori (laver)' was used in gluing together pieces of paper.

sen.j: 古くは『常陸国風土記』（713年）に登場しており、ヤマトタケルに関して次のような記述が見られる。
sen.e: In early times, it appeared in 'Hitachi-no-kuni-fudoki' in 713 (The topographical records of Hitachi country), which has the following descriptions about YAMATO Takeru.
As early as 713, it appeared in 'Hitachi-no-kuni-fudoki (The topographical records of Hitachi county),' which has the following descriptions about YAMATO Takeru:

sen.cmt: ダブルクォートに変更

sen.j: 「古老の曰（い）へらく、倭武の天皇 海辺に巡り幸（いでま）して 乗浜（のりのはま）に行き至りましき。
sen.e: "According to the old man, the emperor YAMATO Takeru came to the beach and arrived in Nori-no-hama.
"According to the old man, Emperor YAMATO Takeru came to the beach and arrived in Nori-no-hama.
According to the old man, Emperor YAMATO Takeru came to the beach and arrived in Nori-no-hama.
sen.cmt: シングルクォートに変更

sen.j: 時に浜浦（はま）の上に多（さは）に海苔｛俗（くにひと）、乃理と云ふ｝を乾せりき。」
sen.e: At that time, lots of seaweeds (locals called them 'nori') were dried on the beach."
At that time, lots of seaweed (locals called it 'nori') were dried on the beach."
At that time, lots of seaweed (locals called it 'nori') were dried on the beach.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォートに変更

sen.j: 同じく『出雲国風土記』（733年）においても、「紫菜（むらさきのり）は、楯縫（たてぬひ）の郡（こほり）、尤（もと）も優（まさ）れり。」という記述がある。
sen.e: Likewise, in 'Izumo-no-kuni-fudoki' in 733 (The topographical records of Izumo country),
Likewise, in 'Izumo-no-kuni-fudoki, (The topographical records of Izumo county),' dating from 733,
Likewise, in "Izumo-no-kuni-fudoki (The topographical records of Izumo county)," dating from 733, there is a description such as 'murasaki nori, in Tatenui County, is the best.'
sen.cmt: 二文→一文（60を59に統合しました）ダブルクォートとシングルクォートを整理

sen.j: なお、楯縫郡は現在の出雲市の内で、2005年合併前の平田市にほぼ相当し、そこには海苔を特産品とする十六島 (出雲市)がある。
sen.e: Tatenui county is now in Izumo city and roughly corresponds to Hirata city before the incorporation in 2005, where Uppurui (Izumo city) produces nori as a specialty good.

The area of Tatenui county is now encompassed within Izumo City and roughly corresponds to Hirata City before the incorporation in 2005, where Uppurui (Izumo City) produces nori as a specialty product.

The area of Tatenui county is now encompassed within Izumo City and roughly corresponds to Hirata City before the incorporation in 2005, where Uppurui (Izumo City) produces nori as a specialty product.

sen.j: 和銅3年（710年）に遷都された平城京には、海草類を売る「にぎめだな」、海苔やコンブを佃煮のように加工したものを売る「もはだな」という市場が存在した。
sen.e: In Heijyo-kyo (the capital of Japan during the Nara period), which was relocated in 710, there were the markets called 'nigimedana' which sold the seaweeds and the markets called 'mohadana' which sold nori or the processed kelp like tsukudani.

In Heijyo-kyo (the capital of Japan during the Nara period), which was relocated in 710, there were the markets called 'nigimedana' which sold the seaweeds and the markets called 'mohadana' which sold nori or the processed kelp like tsukudani.

In Heijyo-kyo, where the capital of Japan was located in 710, there were a market called 'nigimedana' where seaweeds were sold and a market called 'mohadana' where processed nori and kelp like tsukudani were sold.
sen.cmt: relocatedの意味が不明確だと思えるので再構成しました。

sen.j: 大宝 (日本)2年（702年）2月6日に執行された大宝律令においても、海苔が租税として徴収されている（ここから2月6日が海苔の日となっている）。
sen.e: In 'Taiho Ritsuryo' (Taiho Code) enforced on February 6, 702, nori was collected as a tax (and so February 6 is designated as the Nori Day).
In the 'Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code)' enforced on February 6, 702, nori was collected as a tax (and so February 6 is designated as Nori Day).
In the 'Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code)' enforced on February 6, 702, nori was collected as a tax (and so February 6 is designated as Nori Day).

sen.j: こうして海苔は日本の食文化に定着し、987年頃に書かれた『宇津保物語』には、甘海苔や紫海苔といった具体的な名称で海苔が登場している。
sen.e: Thus, nori came to be rooted in Japanese food culture and the nori with the specific name like 'ama nori' or 'murasaki nori' appeared in 'Utsuho-monogatari' (Utsuho Story) written around 987.

Thus, nori came to be rooted in Japanese food culture and nori with the specific names, such as 'ama nori' or 'murasaki nori,' appeared in 'Utsuho-monogatari (Utsuho Story)' which was written in or around 987.

Thus, nori came to be rooted in Japanese food culture and nori with the specific names, such as 'ama nori (sweet nori)' or 'murasaki nori (purple nori),' appeared in "Utsuho-monogatari (Utsuho Story)" which was written in or around 987.

sen.j: 板海苔の誕生
sen.e: The birth of 'ita nori'
The birth of 'ita nori'
The birth of 'ita nori'

sen.j: 江戸時代になると養殖技術が確立し、東京湾で採れた海苔（紫菜）を和紙の製紙技術を用いて紙状に加工するようになり、現在市販されている板海苔が完成する（これに対して乾燥させない海苔は生海苔と呼ばれる）。
sen.e: In the Edo period the cultivation technique was established, the nori (murasaki nori) caught in Tokyo Bay came to be processed into paper-like sheet by using paper manufacture technique of 'washi' (Japanese paper) and finally the 'ita nori' on shelves now saw the light (contrastively, undried nori was called 'nama nori' (raw nori)).

In the Edo period the cultivation technique was established, the nori (murasaki nori) caught in Tokyo Bay came to be processed into paper-like sheets by using the paper manufacturing technique of 'washi (Japanese paper),' and finally the 'ita nori' on shelves saw the light (contrastingly, undried nori was called 'nama nori (raw nori)').

In the Edo period the cultivation technique was established, the nori (murasaki nori) caught in Tokyo Bay came to be processed into paper-like sheets by using the paper manufacturing technique of 'washi (Japanese paper),' and finally the 'ita nori' on shelves saw the light (contrastingly, undried nori was called 'nama nori (raw nori)').

sen.j: なお江戸の海苔の代表とされる浅草海苔に関しては諸説あるが、岡村金太郎著『浅草海苔』（1909年）においては、遅くとも長禄年間（1457～1459年）頃まで遡らせる説が提示されている。
sen.e: Though there are various views on 'Asakusa nori' which is representative of the nori of Edo, the view which put the origin in 1457-1459 at the latest was suggested in "Asakusa nori" written by Kintaro OKAMURA in 1909.

Though there are various views on 'Asakusa nori,' which is representative of the nori of Edo, the view that put the origin in 1457-1459 at the latest was suggested in "Asakusa nori," a 1909 work by Kintaro OKAMURA.

Though there are various views on 'Asakusa nori,' which is representative of the nori of Edo, the view that put the origin in 1457-1459 at the latest was suggested in "Asakusa nori," a 1909 work by Kintaro OKAMURA.

sen.j: 海苔が使われている食品には『磯辺』と表現され、また産地には『磯辺』、『石部』、『磯部』、『石辺』（何れも『いそべ』と読む）などの地名を見ることが出来る。
sen.e: Food products which use nori is expressed as '磯辺' (isobe) and the production areas were named as '石部', '磯部', '石辺' and so on (all are called as 'Isobe').
Food products that used nori were expressed as '磯辺 (isobe)' and the production areas were referred to as '石部,' '磯部,' '石辺' and so on (all are called 'isobe').
Food products that used nori were expressed as '磯辺 (isobe)' and the production areas were referred to as '石部,' '磯部,' '石辺' and so on (all are called 'isobe').

sen.j: 海苔の養殖は江戸時代には始まっていたことが確認される。
sen.e: It is confirmed that the cultivation of nori began during the Edo period.
It is confirmed that the cultivation of nori began during the Edo period.
It is confirmed that the cultivation of nori began during the Edo period.

sen.j: 江戸時代後期には大森（現在の東京都大田区大森）の海苔養殖技術が諏訪海苔商人を介して全国に伝わった。
sen.e: In the later Edo period, the cultivation technique of nori in Omori (currently, Ota-ku Omori, Tokyo prefecture) was introduced nationwide by 'Suwa nori syonin' (Suwa nori merchants).
In the late Edo period, the cultivation technique of nori in Omori (currently, Ota-ku Omori, Tokyo Prefecture) was introduced nationwide by 'Suwa nori syonin (Suwa nori merchants).'
In the late Edo period, the cultivation technique of nori in Omori (currently, Omori, Ota ward, Tokyo Prefecture) was introduced nationwide by 'Suwa nori syonin (Suwa nori merchants).'

sen.j: 海苔の生態が判らなかったため経験則を頼りとしており、その不安定な生産高から「運草」とも呼ばれていた。
sen.e: At that time, as the nori's mode of life was unknown and the nori farmers relied on the rules of thumb, nori was called 'un gusa' (fortune weed) because of its unstable yield quantity.
At that time, as the nori's mode of life was unknown and the nori farmers relied on the rules of thumb, nori was called 'un gusa (fortune weed)' due to its unstable yield quantity.
At that time, as the nori's mode of life was unknown and the nori farmers relied on the rules of thumb, nori was called 'un gusa (fortune weed)' due to its unstable yield quantity.

sen.j: しかし昭和24年（1949年）にイギリスのドリュー女史(Dr. Kathleen Mary Drew Baker 1901年-1957年9月14日)が海苔の糸状体を発見し、それまで不明であった海苔のライフサイクルが解明され、不確実な天然採苗に代わる人工採苗を実用化し、養殖が可能な地域の拡大にも繋がった。
sen.e: However, Dr. Kathleen Mary Drew Baker (1901- Septemper 14, 1957) discovered the filaments of nori in 1949, which elucidated the life cycle of nori that had been unknown until then and led to the expansion of the areas where the cultivation was possible by putting to practical use the artificial seedling collection, instead of the natural one that is unstable.

However, in 1949 Dr. Kathleen Mary Drew Baker (1901- Septemper 14, 1957) discovered the filaments of nori, thus elucidating the heretofore mysterious life cycle and led to the expansion of the areas in which the cultivation was possible by putting to practical use the artificial collection of seedlings instead of the natural one, which was unstable.

However, in 1949 Dr. Kathleen Mary Drew Baker (1901- Septemper 14, 1957) discovered the filaments of nori, thus elucidating the heretofore mysterious life cycle and led to the expansion of the areas in which the cultivation was possible by putting to practical use the artificial collection of seedlings instead of the natural one, which was unstable.

sen.j: 秋、海水温度が約20℃の時、河口近くの海にノリヒビを設置する。
sen.e: When the temperature of seawater is at about 20 degrees C in autumn, 'nori-hibi' is set in the sea near the mouth of a river.
In autumn, when the temperature of seawater is approximately 20 degrees Centrigade, 'nori-hibi' is set in the sea near the mouth of a river.
In autumn, when the temperature of seawater is approximately 20℃, 'nori-hibi' is set in the sea near the mouth of a river.

sen.j: （ノリヒビとは、養殖ノリを付着し、成長させる道具。昔は木や竹ヒビが使われた。現在は網ヒビが主流。）
sen.e: (Nori-hibi is an equipment where the cultured nori adheres and grows. In the past a tree-hibi or a bamboo-hibi were used. Now a net-hibi is mainly used.)
(Nori-hibi is equipment to which the cultured nori adheres and grows. In the past, a tree-hibi or a bamboo-hibi was used. Today, a net-hibi is mainly used.)
(Nori-hibi is equipment to which the cultured nori adheres and grows. In the past, a tree-hibi or a bamboo-hibi was used. Today, a net-hibi is mainly used.)
sen.cmt: （）内の文なので後列をここにまとめて後列を削除しました。

sen.j: ノリヒビに、胞子が付着し、発芽・成長してノリになる。
sen.e: The spores of nori adhere to nori-hibi, germinate and grow to be nori.
The spores of nori adhere to nori-hibi, germinate and grow to be nori.
The spores of nori adhere to nori-hibi, germinate and grow to be nori.

sen.j: そして、葉状に成長したノリを冬に収穫する。
sen.e: And the grown nori that is leafy is harvested in winter.
The grown nori that is leafy is harvested in winter.
The grown nori that is leafy is harvested in winter.

sen.j: 海苔は日本のほか、中国、大韓民国、イギリス、ニュージーランドで養殖もされている。
sen.e: Nori is cultured in China, South Korea, UK and New Zealand as well as in Japan.
Nori is cultured in China, South Korea, the UK and New Zealand, as well as in Japan.
Nori is cultured in China, South Korea, the UK and New Zealand, as well as in Japan.

sen.j: 一時はアメリカ合衆国でも養殖されていたようである。
sen.e: For a while it seems to have been cultured also in the USA.
For a while it seems to have been cultured also in the USA.
For a while it seems to have been cultured also in the USA.

sen.j: イギリス品種であるLaverは、イギリスのウェールズ南部地方で古くから食用にされている。
sen.e: The laver which is a British variety has been used as food in South Wales in the UK since long ago.
The laver, a British variety, has been used as a food in South Wales, UK, since long ago.
The laver, a British variety, has been used as a food in South Wales, UK, since long ago.

sen.j: Laverを茹でてペースト状にしたものがenLaverbreadと呼ばれる物で、そのままパンに塗ったり、油で揚げるなどして食べられている。
sen.e: The food product 'en Laverbread' which was the paste made by boiling laver is eaten by spreading it over the bread as it is or frying it in oil.
The food product 'en Laverbread,' which was a paste made by boiling laver, is eaten by spreading it over the bread as it is or frying it in oil.
The food product 'en Laverbread,' which is a paste made by boiling laver, is eaten by spreading it over the bread as it is or frying it in oil.

sen.j: Laverbreadは日本で言う「珍味」の類であり、同じウェールズでも北部山岳地方ではその存在を知らない人も多く、現地でも決してポピュラーな食べ物ではない。
sen.e: Laverbread is a kind of 'chinmi' (delicacy) in Japan, but in the north mountain region of the same Wales many people do not know it and it is not a popular food at all.
Laverbread is a kind of 'chinmi (delicacy)' in Japan, but in the north mountain region of Wales many people aren't familiar it, so it isn't a popular food there.
Laverbread is a kind of 'chinmi (delicacy)' in Japan, but in the north mountain region of Wales many people aren't familiar it, so it isn't a popular food there.

sen.j: 海苔の大消費地である日本は輸入枠を割り当て制にしており、従来は韓国にのみに輸入枠が割り当てられていた。
sen.e: Though Japan is a big consuming area of nori and applies the import quota system, previously the import quota was allocated only to South Korea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Though Japan is a big consuming area of nori and applies the import quota system, previously the import quota was allocated only to South Korea.
Though Japan is a big consuming area of nori and applies the import quota system, previously the import quota was allocated only to South Korea.

sen.j: しかし、2003年に中国から輸入枠の割り当て申請があり、自国の輸入枠減少を恐れた韓国が日本の海苔市場の自由化を要求、2004年、最終的に世界貿易機関へ協定違反として提訴している。
sen.e: However, as China applied for the import quota in 2003, South Korea, which feared the reduction of the import quota of its own country, asked for the liberalization of the market of nori in Japan, but in 2004 finally filed complaints with World Trade Organization (WTO) as a breach of agreement.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because China applied for the import quota in 2003, South Korea, which feared the reduction of its import quota, asked for the liberalization of the nori market in Japan, but in 2004 South Korea finally filed a complaint with World Trade Organization (WTO) for breach of agreement.

However, because China applied for the import quota in 2003, South Korea, which feared the reduction of its import quota, asked for the liberalization of the nori market in Japan, but in 2004 South Korea finally filed a complaint with World Trade Organization (WTO) for breach of agreement.

sen.j: 日本における水産物輸入枠割当制度は他国にない制度であり、WTOの紛争処理小委員会（パネル）が「クロ」と裁定する可能性は高かった。
sen.e: The import quota system of marine products in Japan did not exist in the other countries and there was a high possibility that the dispute-settlement panel in WHO would hand down a ruling that Japan was guilty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The import quota system of marine products in Japan did not exist in the other countries and there was a high possibility that the WTO's dispute-settlement panel would hand down a ruling that Japan was guilty.

The import quota system of marine products in Japan did not exist in the other countries and there was a high possibility that the WTO's dispute-settlement panel would hand down a ruling that Japan was guilty.

sen.j: もし海苔で敗訴すれば他の水産物輸入枠割当制への影響は必至と見られただろう。
sen.e: If Japan had lost the case on nori, the import quota system of the other marine products would have been surely affected.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: If Japan had lost the case on nori, the import quota system of other marine products would surely have been affected.
If Japan had lost the case on nori, the import quota system of other marine products would surely have been affected.

sen.j: 従って、日本は韓国への海苔輸入枠割当を大幅に増やすことで妥協を図った結果、韓国は2006年1月に提訴を取り下げた。
sen.e: Thus, Japan compromised by drastically increasing the import quota of nori for South Korea, as a result, South Korea withdrew the complaints in January 2006.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thus, Japan compromised by drastically increasing the import quota of nori for South Korea, and consequently South Korea withdrew its complaint in January 2006.
Thus, Japan compromised by drastically increasing the import quota of nori for South Korea, and consequently South Korea withdrew its complaint in January 2006.

sen.j: 韓国からの海苔の輸入枠は2015年までに順次増えてゆき、最終的には2004年の5倍、市場占有率にして7倍までに拡大されることになった。
sen.e: The import quota of nori from South Korea will have sequentially increased until 2015, eventually will be five times larger than that of 2004 and will be expanded seven times larger in the market share.
The import quota of nori from South Korea will increase sequentially until 2015, becoming five times larger than that of 2004, and its market share will grow by seven-fold.
The import quota of nori from South Korea will increase sequentially until 2015, becoming five times larger than that of 2004, and its market share will grow by seven-fold.

sen.j: しかしながら世界的なすしブームや国内需要の増勢の結果、近年の対日輸出実績は割り当て枠を下回る状態となっている。
sen.e: However, because of the sushi boom worldwide and the increase of the domestic demand in South Korea, the recent actual export to Japan is below the quota.
However, because of the sushi boom worldwide and the increased domestic demand in South Korea, today the actual export to Japan is below the quota.
However, because of the sushi boom worldwide and the increased domestic demand in South Korea, today the actual export to Japan is below the quota.

sen.j: 朝鮮半島における海苔については韓国海苔を参照。
sen.e: See 'Kankoku nori' (Korean nori) on the nori in the Korean Peninsula.
See 'Kankoku nori (Korean nori)' for information regarding nori in the Korean Peninsula.
See 'Kankoku nori (Korean nori)' for information regarding nori in the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 中国では1990年代ころから養殖が始まり、江蘇省や山東省が主な産地となっている。
sen.e: In China the cultivation began around the 1990's, the main production areas are in Chiangsu province or Shandong province.
In China, where cultivation began in around the 1990s, the main production areas are in the provinces of Chiangsu and Shandong.
In China, where cultivation began in around the 1990s, the main production areas are in the provinces of Jiangsu and Shandong.

sen.j: 味付け海苔、スナック菓子、コンビニエンスストアのおにぎり等に利用されており、海苔の生産量、消費量ともに増加してきている。
sen.e: Nori in China is used for 'aji-tsuke nori', snacks, 'onigiri' sold in convenience stores and so on and the volumes of both production and consumption are increasing.
In China, nori is used for 'aji-tsuke nori,' snacks, 'onigiri' sold in convenience stores and so on, and the volumes of production and consumption are increasing.
In China, nori is used for 'aji-tsuke nori,' snacks, 'onigiri' sold in convenience stores and so on, and the volumes of production and consumption are increasing.

sen.j: しかし輸入枠の割り当ては行われているものの、値段や品質などの問題もあり、日本へはほとんど輸出されていない一方で、「スシ」などの日本食ブームの影響もあり、日本以外の世界各国へ輸出されている。
sen.e: Though the import quota is applied for China, the export to Japan is very scarce because of the price and quality problem, however, Chinese nori is exported to around the world except Japan because of the influence from the Japanese food boom like 'sushi'.

Though the import quota is applied for China, exports to Japan are very scarce because of the price and quality problem; however, Chinese nori is exported to destinations around the world (except for Japan) because of the influence of the Japanese food boom, as has occurred with sushi.

Though the import quota is applied for China, exports to Japan are very scarce because of the price and quality problem; however, Chinese nori is exported to destinations around the world (except for Japan) because of the influence of the Japanese food boom, as has occurred with sushi.

sen.j: このため2005年から始まった対日輸出は現在実質的に停止状態にある。
sen.e: Thus, the export to Japan since 2005 has now come to a virtual standstill.
Thus, exports to Japan since 2005 have come to a virtual standstill.
Thus, exports to Japan which begun in 2005 have come to a virtual standstill today.

tit.e: The production areas of nori in Japan
The nori production areas in Japan
The nori production areas in Japan

sen.j: 海苔の主な産地は宮城県、千葉県、愛知県、兵庫県の播磨灘沿岸、香川県の島嶼部（小豆島、直島など）、そして福岡県、佐賀県、熊本県の有明海沿岸が主産地となっている。
sen.e: The main production areas of nori are in Miyagi prefecture, Chiba prefecture, Aichi prefecture, the coastal area along the Harima Sea, the small islands in Kagawa prefecture (Shodo-shima island, Nao-shima island, and so on), Fukuoka prefecture, Saga prefecture and the coastal area along the Ariake Sea.

The main production areas of nori are in Miyagi Prefecture, Chiba Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture, the coastal area along the Harima Sea, the small islands in Kagawa Prefecture (Shodo-shima, Nao-shima and so on), Fukuoka Prefecture, Saga Prefecture and the coastal area along the Ariake Sea.

The main production areas of nori are in Miyagi Prefecture, Chiba Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture, the coastal area along the Harima Sea of Hyogo Prefecture, the small islands in Kagawa Prefecture (Shodo-shima, Nao-shima and so on), Fukuoka Prefecture, Saga Prefecture and the coastal area along the Ariake Sea of Kumamoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: of Hyogo Prefecture, of Kumamoto Prefectureを追加

sen.j: 中でも有明海沿岸の三県で生産量の40%強を占める一大産地となっており、贈答向けの高級品も多く生産されている。
sen.e: Among them, the three prefectures along the Ariake Sea are the big production areas which account for over 40 % of the whole production amount and produce lots of the high-quality goods for gift-giving.

Among them, the three prefectures along the Ariake Sea are the big production areas; they account for over 40% of the total production amount and produce large quantities of high-quality goods for gift-giving.

Among them, the three prefectures along the Ariake Sea are the big production areas; they account for over 40% of the total production amount and produce large quantities of high-quality goods for gift-giving.

sen.j: また、この有明海沿岸は諫早湾干拓問題で大きく揺れた地域であり、事業開始直後は水質の汚濁などによって海苔の生産量や品質に大きく影響を与え、とりわけ長崎県の産地は壊滅的打撃を受けた。
sen.e: And the coastal area along the Ariake Sea was the area where the problem of draining Isahaya Bay arose, just after the operation, the water contamination strongly influenced the production volume or quality of nori there and in particular devastated the production area in Nagasaki prefecture.

Additionally, the coastal area along the Ariake Sea was where the problem of draining Isahaya Bay arose, when, just after the operation, the water contamination strongly influenced the production volume or quality of nori there and devastated the production area in Nagasaki Prefecture.

Additionally, the coastal area along the Ariake Sea was where the problem of draining Isahaya Bay arose, when, just after the operation begun, the water contamination strongly influenced the production volume and quality of nori there, and in particular devastated the production area in Nagasaki Prefecture.

sen.j: 他に中四国の岡山県、広島県、徳島県などでも海苔養殖が行われている。
sen.e: Furthermore, the cultivation of nori is done in Okayama prefecture, Hiroshima prefecture, Tokushima prefecture and so on in Chugoku and Shikoku region.
Furthermore, the cultivation of nori is done in Okayama Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Tokushima Prefecture and so on in the regions of Chugoku and Shikoku.
Furthermore, the cultivation of nori is done in Okayama Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Tokushima Prefecture and so on in the regions of Chugoku and Shikoku.

sen.j: 日本国外では板海苔を見てカーボン紙を連想する人も多く、また「歯の裏にくっつく」、「紙を食べているよう」と嫌がることがある。
sen.e: Outside of Japan, there are many people who associate 'ita nori' with a sheet of carbon paper and detest it, saying 'it sticks to the back sides of teeth' or 'it's like eating a sheet of paper.'

Outside of Japan, there are many people who associate 'ita nori' with a sheet of carbon paper and detest it, saying that 'it sticks to the back sides of the teeth' or 'it's like eating a sheet of paper.'

Outside of Japan, there are many people who associate 'ita nori' with a sheet of carbon paper and detest it, saying that 'it sticks to the back sides of the teeth' or 'it's like eating a sheet of paper.'

sen.j: この理由により、海外の巻き寿司は米が外側で海苔が内側にあることが多い。
sen.e: For this reason, overseas 'maki zushi' (sushi roll) has a rice part outside and a nori part inside.
For this reason, overseas the 'maki zushi (sushi roll)' has the rice part outside and the nori part inside.
For this reason, overseas the 'maki zushi (sushi roll)' has the rice part outside and the nori part inside.

sen.j: 「海苔」はラテン語圏でも「Nori」で通じる。
sen.e: Nori' gets through Romance language-speaking world as it does.
sen.cmt: ラテン語圏」というと「ラテン語を話す世界」が今でもあるかのような誤解を招きますので、俗ラテン語であるスペイン語・フランス語・イタリア語などを指す総称として、Romance languageと言い換えました。
sen.e: The term 'nori' is used in the Romance language world just as it is.
The term 'nori' is used in the Romance language world just as it is.

sen.j: 「Laver」は板海苔にはせず、また、イギリス以外では余り通用していない言葉である。
sen.e: The 'laver' is not processed into 'ita nori' and the word is not so comprehensible except in the UK.
However, the 'laver' is not processed into 'ita nori,' and the word isn't a familiar one to people outside the UK.
However, the 'laver' is not processed into 'ita nori,' and the word isn't a familiar one to people outside the UK.

sen.j: 海苔のつるつるしているほうが表、そうでない方が裏だといわれている。
sen.e: The smooth side of nori is said to be a head and the other is to be a tail.
The smooth side of nori is said to be a head and the other is to be a tail.
The smooth side of nori is said to be a head and the other is to be a tail.

sen.j: 実際は板海苔に加工する際に板側の方が平らになる為であり、裏表は無い。
sen.e: When processed into 'ita nori', the board side of nori becomes smooth, so in fact, the heads and tails do not exist.
When processed into 'ita nori,' the board side of nori becomes smooth, so in fact the heads and tails do not exist.
